Description: back pay award in unfair labor practices case
Info Source: Extracted from an NLRB dataset covering 1999-2011 downloaded at https://catalog.data.gov/dataset/nlrb-cats-final-c-case-data-bulk-19990101-20110930-in-xml

Agency: Labor Department Wage and Hour Division
Info Source: March 7, 2017 download of a dataset posted by the Wage and Hour Division at https://enforcedata.dol.gov/views/data_summary.php
Notes: Date and year are the Findings End Date in the dataset posted by the Wage and Hour Division, which does not provide case opening or closing dates. The company name is the Legal Name provided by the dataset unless that field is blank, in which case the Trade Name is used. The dataset provides only one address and does not indicate whether it is the company headquarters address or the establishment address. The penalty amount is the total of civil monetary penalties and mandated back wages. The original dataset provides a breakdown.

Description: Eight firms agreed to pay a total of $320,000 to settle allegations that they failed to report to the CPSC, as required by federal law, that their children's hooded sweatshirts or jackets were sold with drawstrings at the hood and neck and thus posed a strangulation hazard.
Info Source: https://www.cpsc.gov/Newsroom/News-Releases/2008/Eight-Firms-Agree-To-Pay-320000-For-Failing-To-Timely-Report-Drawstrings-In-Childrens-Outerwear

Agency: Labor Department Wage and Hour Division
Info Source: https://www.dol.gov/newsroom/releases/whd/whd20180329

Court: Superior Court of State of California, County of Los Angeles
Private Litigation Case Title: PHILIP CLAVEL VS 99 CENTS ONLY STORES LLC
Info Source: https://www.sec.gov/Archives/edgar/data/1011290/000110465917072525/a17-20565_110q.htm
Notes: The settlement figure is the amount the company said in an SEC filing that it contributed to a total settlement amount of $500,000 involving other defendants.

Court: Superior Court of State of California, County of Sacramento
Private Litigation Case Title: Luis Palencia v. 99 Cents Only Stores
Info Source: https://www.sec.gov/Archives/edgar/data/1011290/000110465913009751/a13-1930_110q.htm
Notes: While the court document lists a settlement amount of $3.2 million, the company's SEC filing said it had accrued $2.2 million for payments related to the case.

Court: Superior Court of State of California, County of Los Angeles
Private Litigation Case Title: SHERIDAN REED VS 99 CENTS ONLY STORES
Info Source: https://www.sec.gov/Archives/edgar/data/1011290/000110465913009724/a13-4405_110qa.htm#Item1_LegalProceedings_123740
Notes: The company agreed to pay $700,000 less a credit of $155,431 that had already been paid. In an SEC filing the company said $600,000 had been accrued for expected payments in the case.

Court: Superior Court of State of California, County of Ventura
Info Source: https://www.sec.gov/Archives/edgar/data/1011290/000114036108024588/form10q.htm#legal
Notes: This case was settled together with the Los Angeles County case Washington vs. 99 Cents Only Stores.

Court: Superior Court of State of California, County of Los Angeles
Private Litigation Case Title: CARLOS RODRIGUEZ VS THE GUITAR CENTER
Info Source: https://www.sec.gov/Archives/edgar/data/1021113/000110465906073652/a06-21563_110q.htm#NotesToConsolidatedFinancialState_022305
Notes: The settlement also covered another case in the same court: James McClain et. al. v. Guitar Center Stores, Inc. (Case No. BC326002).

Court: Superior Court of State of California, County of Los Angeles
Private Litigation Case Title: Melgoza vs. 99 Cents Only Stores and Ramirez vs. 99 Cents Only Stores
Info Source: https://www.sec.gov/Archives/edgar/data/1011290/000114036105007262/body.htm

Agency: Labor Department Wage and Hour Division
Info Source: https://www.dol.gov/newsroom/releases/whd/whd20180508-1

Private Litigation Case Title: Holly Attia et al v. The Neiman Marcus Group, Inc., et al
Info Source: https://www.law360.com/articles/1123438/ex-neiman-marcus-workers-seek-4-4m-wage-row-deal-ok

Description: Neiman Marcus agreed to pay $1.5 million to settle multistate litigiation arising from a 2013 data breach involving 370,000 payment cards.
Info Source: https://law.georgia.gov/press-releases/2019-01-08/carr-and-others-reach-settlement-neiman-marcus-over-2013-data-breach

Description: SMG, manager of concession and catering services at the Worcester Centrum Centre agreed to pay more than $545,000 to settle charges that it failed to pay gratuities earned by food service workers.
Info Source: https://web.archive.org/web/20030301152211/http://www.ago.state.ma.us/press_rel/smgsettle.asp

Description: 99 Cents Only Stores agreed to pay $2.36 million in settlement of allegations it improperly disposed of hazardous material in company trash bins, resulting it it being unlawfully transported to area landfills. Settlement was with 28 California agencies.
Info Source: https://www.sandiego.gov/sites/default/files/nr150106.pdf
